Method

If intermittent catheterisation is needed, the child's doctor will determine how often the catheter needs to be changed per day. The attending physician also determines the diameter and length of the catheter.

A good conversation and instruction is very important when preparing the child. Inserting a catheter does not hurt, but children may perceive the sensation as being “weird”. There are also times that the child may feel a burning sensation due to irritation.

Catheterisation can be performed in various ways:

  • Sitting on the toilet
  • Standing on the toilet
  • Lying on the bed
  • Lying on a treatment table
